Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbinauts (is that right?)

I've just downloaded this sim/game/whatever a few days ago, and have just made my first landing (and return) from the Mun with the Soyuz addon... (Which Frankly is fabulous)

I've a fascination in spaceflight (both from a physics sense and historical sense), and have spent at least a year or so playing on Orbiter, which is kind of like KSP, but much more focused on realistic orbital physics (n-body systems etc), but (for obvious reasons isn't as fun). I eventually decided I'd like to start designing my own rockets (you can do that on Orbiter, but I've never been very good with coding etc)...

I fell in love with KSP as soon as I started playing it, and after fiddling around with several unsuccessful rocket designs, I finally got the hang of it (yes I understand the irony that I wanted to create my own rockets, and then ended up using someone else's to land on the Mun)...

Looking forward to exploring more of the program, and excited for more updates...

F

Hi Frednutts, welcome to the community

I think KSP's "build it yourself, fly it yourself" nature is what makes it so much fun, the physics are there for proper orbital activities yet it's still accessible.
